== Main Inclusion Report for o3read ==

=== Requirements ===

 0. ''Availability:'' http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/o/o3read/ ; available for all supported architectures

 0. ''Rationale:''
** Let tracker index OpenOffice.org documents.
** Make possible to install the library by default.
** Drop the internal copy of o3read that tracker ships.
 0. ''Security:''
** Just one (very old) CVE entry for o3read <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=o3read]]</nowiki>.
** Same old entry in <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=o3read|Secunia history]]</nowiki>.
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.
** Does not open any port.

 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** See <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/pkgreport.cgi?src=o3read|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>
** See <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/o3read/|Ubuntu bugs]]</nowiki>
** Does not deal with exotic hardware which we cannot support.

 0. ''Standards compliance:''
** Meets <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki>

 0. ''Dependencies:''
** All in Main

=== Reviewers ===
MartinPitt: looks harmless enough; despite <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/359820|Debian #359820]]</nowiki>, it does work for .odt, too. Approved
